task.title: Properties
task.shortdesc: Use Properties editor to edit the appearance and content of the views chosen for a workspace.

taskbody.prereq: To view the Properties editor, your user ID must have necessary permissions.

context.p: To open a Properties, do the following steps:

step.cmd: The Properties editor opens with a list of the views on the left, grouped by type.
On the right, the general workspace properties will appear.

Select one of the views in the Properties tree. All types of views have a Style tab, with different options for the type of view. The table, charts, and topology views have Query and Filters tabs, table and topology have a Thresholds tab, and terminal emulators have a Configuration tab.
Change the data elements for a chart or table or change the styling of a view.
When you are done, you can close the Properties editor by clicking on the Cancel button.
